TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MergeEventArgs extends System.EventArgs
Public MustInherit Class MergeEventArgs Inherits EventArgs
public ref class MergeEventArgs abstract : EventArgs

remarks.para: The MergeEventArgs class provides properties that can be used during a Merge event to programmatically interact with the underlying XML document of the current form that's being merged, to determine the number of files being merged, to cancel the event, and to determine when and how to rollback changes that occurred during a merge operation that was cancelled.

example.para: For an example of using some of the properties of the MergeEventArgs class, see the sample code in the event topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property CancelableArgs As XmlFormCancelEventArgs

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the object.

remarks.para: Access the XmlFormCancelEventArgs object to cancel the event and specify a custom message to display when the event is cancelled.
The MergeEventArgs.CancelableArgs.Cancel property is set to true by default.
This property can be used only during the Merge event.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: abstract property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the count of the number of forms being merged in a merging operation.
Docs.value: The number of forms being merged.

remarks.para: The Count property can be used in combination with the property to determine when the last form was merged.
This property can be used only during the event.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Index As Integer
public: abstract property int Index { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the form that is currently being merged.
Docs.value: The numeric index of the form being merged.

remarks.para: The value of the Index property increases from 0 to -1 for each event that occurs when multiple forms are merged.
When used in combination with the Count property, the Index property can be used to determine when the last form has been merged.
This property can be used only during the Merge event.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool Rollback { get; set; }
Public MustOverride Property Rollback As Boolean
public: abstract property bool Rollback { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Rollback : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that is used with the Cancel property to determine whether to cancel only the current form or the entire merging operation.
Docs.value: true if the merging operation will be rolled back; otherwise false.

remarks.para: If the Cancel property (accessed using the property) is set to false, this property is ignored.

If the Cancel property is true and the RollBack property is true, the entire merging operation will be cancelled and rolled back to the state before the operation was initiated. If the Cancel property is false and the RollBack property is true, merging the current form will fail, but the merging operation will continue with the next form.
This property can be used only during the event.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Xml As XPathNavigator
public: abstract property System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ Xml { System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an XPathNavigator object positioned at the root node of the underlying XML document of the form that is currently being merged.
Docs.value: An XPathNavigator object positioned at the root node of the form.

remarks.para: The Xml property allows you to access and manipulate the source XML of a form programmatically. After you have set a reference to the returned XPathNavigator object, you can use any of its properties and methods to access and manipulate the source XML data of the form.
This property can be used only during the event.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.
